instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-3662: What is 820-3662? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.PP5V_S4: What is PP5V_S4? PP5V_S4 is a 5v power rail present when the machine is in an S4 suspend to disk state..
definitions.U7501: What is U7501? This chip is often responsible for creating PP3V3_S5,  PP3V3_S3,  PP3V3_S0,  PP5V_S5,  PP5V_S4,  PP5V_S0.
definitions.820-3662A: What is 820-3662A? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.PM_SLP_S5_L: What is PM_SLP_S5_L? PM_SLP_S5_L is a signal that, when 3.3v, turns on power rails that will wake the system from an S5 state. This signal is a part of the power management system of the MacBook.  The \"PM\" prefix typically stands for \"Power Management,\" and the \"SLP\" is for \"Sleep.\" The \"S5\" denotes the specific sleep state, which is Suspend to Disk, and the \"_L\" suffix indicates that this is an active low signal..
definitions.S4_PWR_EN: What is S4_PWR_EN? S4_PWR_EN turns on the S4 power rails. Signals ending in _EN enable whatever came before _EN in the signal name when the voltage of the signal is high. .
definitions.PP3V3_S5: What is PP3V3_S5? PP3V3_S5 is a 3.3v power rail when the system is in an S5 soft off power state.
definitions.P3V3S5_EN: What is P3V3S5_EN? P3V3S5_EN is a signal that enables the power chip responsible for creating PP3V3_S5 when it is high. Signals with _EN mean that whatever is mentioned before the _EN will be enabled or turned on when the signal is high. .
definitions.PP5V_S5: What is PP5V_S5? This is a 5v power rail that is present when the machine is in an S5 soft off state..
definitions.PPVRTC_G3H: What is PPVRTC_G3H? PPVRTC_G3H is a 3.3v power rail for the RTC circuit present when the machine is in a G3H global system hardware off state. .
definitions.SMC_PM_G2_EN: What is SMC_PM_G2_EN? SMC_PM_G2_EN is a signal that comes from the SMC that is a prerequsite for all of the enable signals for the S5 rails to come on, such as P3V3S5_EN. S5 rails will not come on if SMC_PM_G2_EN is not coming..
definitions.5V_S4: What is 5V_S4? This is an abbreviation of “PP5V_S4” – when you see this, assume the person typing it meant to type “PP5V_S4”.
definitions.P3V3_S5_EN: What is P3V3_S5_EN? P3V3_S5_EN is a typo of P3V3S5_EN which is a signal that enables the power chip responsible for creating PP3V3_S5. .
definitions.PP3V3_S0: What is PP3V3_S0? The "PP3V3_S0" rail in a MacBook logic board is a power rail that supplies 3.3 volts to the system when it is fully awake (S0 state). .

threads.title: Macbook <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3662</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A  <SIGNAL>PP5V_S4</SIGNAL> Missing. Green/orange light no power
threads.message: Hi guys, working on <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3662A</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>  logic board. Green orange light is on when charger plugged in but no power. <SIGNAL>PP5V_S4</SIGNAL> missing. Checked <SIGNAL>P5VS4_EN</SIGNAL> and its missing. It comes from <CHIP>U8170</CHIP> <SIGNAL>S4_PWR_EN</SIGNAL> where pin 2-  <SIGNAL>PM_SLP_S5_L</SIGNAL> is 0V. A little bit strange as <SIGNAL>P5VS4_EN</SIGNAL>= 0.07V but S4 PWR EN= 0V. Where does the 0.07V comes from? Chip <CHIP>U7501</CHIP> itself ? Any help?

threads.title: Macbook <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3662</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A  <SIGNAL>PP5V_S4</SIGNAL> Missing. Green/orange light no power
Macbook <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3662</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A  <SIGNAL>PP5V_S4</SIGNAL> Missing. Green/orange light no power
threads.message: Let's start with basics: Exact voltage on PPBUS? <SIGNAL>SMC_PM_G2_EN</SIGNAL> present? <SIGNAL>PP5V_S5</SIGNAL> and <SIGNAL>PPVRTC_G3H</SIGNAL> present?

threads.title: Macbook <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3662</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A  <SIGNAL>PP5V_S4</SIGNAL> Missing. Green/orange light no power
threads.message: History? <SIGNAL>5V_S4</SIGNAL> can be missing for 100 different reasons, not just a simple on/off.

threads.title: Macbook <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3662</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A  <SIGNAL>PP5V_S4</SIGNAL> Missing. Green/orange light no power
Macbook <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3662</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A  <SIGNAL>PP5V_S4</SIGNAL> Missing. Green/orange light no power
threads.message: Looks pretty clean no obvious liquid damage.

threads.title: Macbook <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3662</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A  <SIGNAL>PP5V_S4</SIGNAL> Missing. Green/orange light no power
Macbook <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3662</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A  <SIGNAL>PP5V_S4</SIGNAL> Missing. Green/orange light no power
Macbook <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3662</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A  <SIGNAL>PP5V_S4</SIGNAL> Missing. Green/orange light no power
threads.message: Diode mode <SIGNAL>PP3V3_S5</SIGNAL> = 131 .should be more i guess right?

threads.title: Macbook <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3662</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A  <SIGNAL>PP5V_S4</SIGNAL> Missing. Green/orange light no power
threads.message:
Check <CHIP>U7501</CHIP> area for corrosion especially pin 23. 
131 on 3V3 is normal so if no corrosion and <SIGNAL>G2_EN</SIGNAL> and <SIGNAL>P3V3_S5_EN</SIGNAL> present <CHIP>U7501</CHIP> is a good suspect.

threads.title: Macbook <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3662</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A  <SIGNAL>PP5V_S4</SIGNAL> Missing. Green/orange light no power
threads.message: ok quick update. I have managed to turn the board on with holding power button on-removing charger while holding button-and plugging charger back in while holding button still and it turned on. so fans started to spin but no chime or video. i was measuring around <CHIP>U7310</CHIP> as there was no power from L7310, l7320,l7330 and u73010 had power present but nothing on output. then i touched pin 40 with pin 39 by accidend and now i bumped into another problem as dont have <SIGNAL>PPVIN_S5_HS_COMPUTING_ISNS</SIGNAL>. when i touched them two pins board switched off and now <SIGNAL>PPVIN_S5_HS_COMPUTING_ISNS</SIGNAL>= 0.5V what the hell have i F***ked up. any ideas what was wrong when it was working with no chime and what have i shorted now? please dont judge as i am just enthusiast with repairing not professional.

threads.title: Macbook <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3662</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A  <SIGNAL>PP5V_S4</SIGNAL> Missing. Green/orange light no power
threads.message: Pretty sure you shorted out <CHIP>U7310</CHIP> and put PPBUS on the CPU. This is fatal, the end dead CPU in 99% of the cases. <CHIP>U7310</CHIP> is dead for sure at least now.

threads.title: Macbook <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3662</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A  <SIGNAL>PP5V_S4</SIGNAL> Missing. Green/orange light no power
threads.message:
ok so changed <CHIP>U7310</CHIP>,and it <SIGNAL>PPVIN_S5_HS_COMPUTING_ISNS</SIGNAL>=12.5V. Board switches on with keyboard bypass(holding pwr button/removing charger,attaching charger again /reease button and press again)
PP5V-s0 present, <SIGNAL>PP3V3_S0</SIGNAL> present but no chime and no video as it was before. Gonna check power rails whats missing. any ideas what to check first or why it only switches on with bypass? thanks.

threads.title: Macbook <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3662</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A  <SIGNAL>PP5V_S4</SIGNAL> Missing. Green/orange light no power
Macbook <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3662</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A  <SIGNAL>PP5V_S4</SIGNAL> Missing. Green/orange light no power
threads.message: But it was exactly the same after liquid damage, before i messed up with it. Is it worth trying to check it? maybe cpu  is not dead after all? any specific ways to check cpu?

threads.title: Macbook <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3662</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A  <SIGNAL>PP5V_S4</SIGNAL> Missing. Green/orange light no power
threads.message: The CPU got 12V and is dead, don't waste your time.
